clinical_study.official_title: European Hypotension Prediction Index Real World Experience Using AcumenTM Hypotension Prediction Index Software to Prevent Intraoperative Hypotension: the Multicentre Prospective Observational Registry

brief_summary.textblock: European, multicenter, prospective, observational registry in patients undergoing elective major non-cardiac surgery

primary_outcome.measure: To describe the time-weighted average (TWA) mean arterial pressure (MAP) <65 mmHg when using AcumenTM Hypotension Prediction Index software
primary_outcome.time_frame: Duration of the procedure through 30 days after procedure
primary_outcome.description: To describe the time-weighted average (TWA) mean arterial pressure (MAP) <65 mmHg when using AcumenTM Hypotension Prediction Index software

clinical_study.condition: To Describe the Incidence, Duration, and Severity of Intraoperative Hypotension Using AcumenTM Hypotension Prediction Index Software

intervention.description: The AcumenTM HPI Feature Software provides the clinician with physiological insight into a patient's likelihood of trending toward a hypotensive event. The AcumenTM HPI Feature Software suite is enabled by the minimally invasive Acumen IQ sensor.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Consenting adult patients (â‰¥18 years)
- Patient is scheduled for elective major non-cardiac surgery under general anesthesia that is expected to last at least 120 minutes and in whom blood pressure is monitored using an arterial catheter.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing emergency surgery OR nephrectomy, liver and/or kidney transplantation
- Patients suffering from atrial fibrillation and/or sepsis (according to current Sepsis-3 definition)
- American Society of Anesthesiology (ASA) physical status classification V or VI
- Disability and/or other circumstances under which the patient is not able to understand the nature, significance and scope of the investigation
- Pregnancy at the time of surgery
- Patients without signed informed consent / data protection statement
- Patient participates in other interventional trials
